Package engine.forGUI

Class ChessboardTable

java.lang.Object
engine.forGUI.Chessboard
public class ChessboardTable extends Object
Represents and creates a GUI chess board.
The ChessboardTable class is responsible for managing the graphical user interface (GUI) of a chess board. It provides a visual representation of the chess board, handles user interactions, and updates the board state accordingly. The class utilizes various components such as JFrame, JPanel, and MouseListener to create and manage the GUI elements. It also interacts with other classes such as Board, Piece, and Move to handle game logic and data.

Instance Data:
gameFrame: The main frame of the GUI chess board.
gameHistoryPanel: Panel to display the game history.
takenPieces: Panel to display the captured pieces.
boardPanel: Panel representing the chess board.
chessBoard: The current state of the chess board.
sourceTile: The source tile selected by the user for making a move.
destinationTile: The destination tile selected by the user for making a move.
humanMovedPiece: The piece moved by the human player.
boardDirection: The direction of the board, either normal or flipped.
highlightLegalMoves: Indicates whether legal moves should be highlighted on the board.
lightTileColor: The color of the light-colored tiles on the board.
darkTileColor: The color of the dark-colored tiles on the board.
OUTER_FRAME_DIMENSION: The dimensions of the outer frame of the GUI.
boardDimension: The dimensions of the chess board panel.
tileDimension: The dimensions of a single tile on the board.
defaultPieceImages: The directory path for default piece images.

The ChessboardTable class also contains several nested classes for specific functionality:
BoardDirection: An enum representing the direction of the board.
BoardPanel: A panel that visualizes the chess board.
MoveLog: A class representing the move log of the game.
TilePanel: A panel representing an individual tile on the board.
Note: This class uses external libraries such as Google Guava and Javax Swing for additional functionality. The class provides methods to create and manage the GUI elements, handle user interactions, and update the board state. It also includes methods to draw the board, assign tile colors, assign piece icons, and highlight legal moves. Additionally, the class contains methods to create menu bars, menus, and menu items for file operations and preferences.
